title: Print
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Sheet with two projects for ceiling decorations, from a set "Plafons à la Romaine." Two quarters are shown separated by a stripe with the scale. At left: oblong central representation with Mars chasing a giant. At right: circular central representation with two fleeing giants. Captive and trophie of arms occur in either design. Bottom margin: "I le Pautre In. et Fecit Iollain excudit Via Iacobea sub signo Vrbis Coloniae. cum Priuilegio Regis 2." Reverse: Men at a ball game; a watcher sits sidewise on a bench. A house in the central distance.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print.
Etching. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-100-1.
